Objective.evidence: We aim to determine factors associated with stroke or death at 30 days in the stenting arm of the SAMMPRIS trial.

Method_Outcome.evidence: We compared patient specific variables, lesion specific variables, procedure specific variables, and FDA approved indications between patients with and without the primary outcome (stroke or death at 30 days).

Number_Analysed.evidence: We identified 213 patients; 30 patients (14.1%) met the primary outcome.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Smoking status and lesion length were associated with the primary outcome; the odds of stroke or death for non-smokers vs. smokers (adjusted OR 4.46, 95% CI 1.79–11.1, p = 0.001) and with increasing lesion length in millimeters (adjusted OR 1.20, 95% CI 1.02–1.39, p = 0.029).
